meanings.definition: A consequence, effect, or outcome of something.
meanings.sent1: The result of eating too much cake was a stomachache.
meanings.sent2: The test result showed that she had studied well.
meanings.sent3: As a result of his clumsiness, he tripped over his own feet.
meanings.sent4: The result of their teamwork was a successful project completion.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained the test result in simple terms to the patient.

meanings.definition: To arise or occur as a consequence of something.
meanings.sent1: His laziness will result in him failing the class.
meanings.sent2: Skipping breakfast can result in feeling tired later in the day.
meanings.sent3: She knew that procrastinating would result in a last-minute rush.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain resulted in flooding in the low-lying areas.
meanings.sent5: Not following the instructions can result in a failed experiment.

meanings.definition: To end in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: The negotiations resulted in a mutually beneficial agreement.
meanings.sent2: The game resulted in a tie after a thrilling overtime period.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fix the car resulted in more damage than before.
meanings.sent4: The party resulted in everyone having a great time and making new friends.
meanings.sent5: The project resulted in a beautiful piece of artwork that amazed everyone.
